page.title: 18PIGEON HOUSE FARM ETON WICK
page.content:
{Pigeon House Farm}is very old. It is in the first{Domesday Book}and is the second oldest on the Common and Dorney.{Mr.Palmer}is the owner and {Richard George}is the manager of Pigeon House Farm.
Mr.George is hoping for 300 lambs from 150 ewes and has 260 bulls. Lambs are for breeding and roasting. Two geese walk about the farm.
He also has 3 tractors, one with a loader, plough, sprayer for fertilizer, roll and harrow, muck spreader and forage box.
The crops grown are winter barley, winter wheat, forage, and maize. Soft fruits are also grown and some of the land is permanent pasture.
